description.narrative: Capacity Building for Project Implementation Unit (PIU) Members and KGRTC Staff 1. Small Hydropower Station:- 5 PIU Members trained in “Hydro, Mechanical and Electrical Design of Hydropower Plants”;- 4 PIU Members trained in “System Integration and Environmental Aspects of Small Hydropower Plants”; - 6 KGRTC Management Staff trained in “Management for Small Hydropower Plants”. 2.Wind Resource Assessment: - 3 PIU Members trained on “Wind Resource Assessment using WindPRO and WAsP software”;- 2 PIU Members trained in “MET Mast Installation” during Factory Acceptance Test; and- 6 KGRTC Management Staff trained in “Wind Farm Management Awareness”. 3. Power Systems Simulator:- 2 PIU Members trained in use of 3 KEYMASTER Design Tool during “Project Design Review and Design Finalization”;- 3 PIU Members trained in “Power Systems Modeling and Integration” during Pre-FAT; and- 3 KGRTC PIU Members trained in “Power Systems Modeling and Integration” during FAT. Small Hydropower Station Feasibility Study Report and Cost Estimates “With design flow of 11.0 m3/s the selected site has the highest indicative potential for constructing a 10.35 MW Hydropower Station with Annual Energy production of 90.7 GWh, and enhanced classical small hydropower station features suitable for training, at an estimated CAPEX of USD31.66 Million (including detailed design and site supervision/ Owner’s Engineer) and a construction period of 3.3 years.” Tender Documents based on World Bank standards and FIDIC Contract Forms have been developed. Environmental and Social Impact Assessment (ESIA) report and Environmental Mitigation Plan (EMP) approved by ZEMA for three (3) years from March 2018. New Learning Centre - Detailed Architectural and Engineering Designs with 3D models have already been done.- Tender Documents with Cost Estimates and Forms of Contract, Work Specifications, Implementation Plan and Construction Schedule.- Environmental Project Brief has been approved by ZEMA. Wind Resource Assessment and Wind Farm 13.5 Months of site meteorological data collected from a 60 meters MET Mast has indicated potential for commercial viability of KGRTC Wind Farm at 90 meters hub height with mean wind speed of 5.4 m/s and a net annual energy production of 13.3 GWh with P50 net Capacity Factor (CF) of about 20.2% based on 3 x Goldwind G121 Wind Turbine Generators (WTGs) of 7.2 MW total installed capacity at an estimated CAPEX of USD13.4 Million Power Systems Simulator and Building Fully Functional Building and Simulator “Customized Power Systems Simulator based on the Transmission Network of Zambia, Network for the Copperbelt Energy Corporation (CEC), Distribution Network of Lusaka, Transmission Network of Uganda, and the Reduced Network for Southern Africa Power Pool (SAPP) was commissioned, complete with a 24 MW Generic Dam Simulator and seventeen (17) computers with double screens housed in a new building”. During the course of implementation, Sida granted “no objection” to the request by KGRTC to extend the Activity and Agreement period for the project from 30 June 2015 and 31 December 2015 respectively, to 31 September 2017 and 31 December 2017 respectively; and subsequently to 9 March 2018 and 31 March 2018 respectively. This was mainly due to delays experienced in executing the detailed feasibility studies for the Small Hydropower Station and the Wind Resource Assessment (WRA) projects, as well as the delay in operationalizing the project implementation unit at the start of the project. The above notwithstanding, the major milestones and compliances achieved were:(a) Feasibility Study for the 10.35 MW Small Hydropower Station; (b) Design of the KGRTC New Learning Centre; (c) Feasibility Study for 7.4 MW Wind Farm; and (d) Design, Installation and Commissioning of the Power Systems Simulator and Building. The construction of the Furnished Simulator Building, with Solar Backup Power Supply installed on rooftop whas not planned from the initial stage. the initial planned ended up at design leve.
